item.title: Journalist killed in Dhaka road crash
item.description: A 52-year-old journalist was killed when an unidentified vehicle hit his motorbike on Khilgaon Flyover in the capital on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Zahir Bhuiyan, sports reporter of Daily Vorer Pata and son of Shamsuddin Bhuiya of Muradnagar upazila in Cumilla district. Zahir, father

item.title: AB Bank inaugurates its relocated Savar Branch
item.description: AB Bank PLC has recently relocated its Savar Branch to M. A Mannan Tower, Palashbari, Dhamsona, Ashulia, Dhaka. Mr. Syed Mizanur Rahman, Managing Director & CEO, AB Bank inaugurated the branch through video conference from Bank’s head office, according to a press release. Savar Branch Manag

item.title: Al-Arafah Islami Bank distributes agricultural investment in Chuadanga
item.description: Al-Arafah Islami Bank’s Chuadanga Branch organised a public agricultural investment distribution programme at Alukdia in Chuadanga Sadar. Managing Director (Acting) Mohd. Rafat Ullah Khan distributed agricultural investments worth a total of Tk 25.3 million among 201 farmers at a ceremony he

item.title: BGMEA signs MoU with BFF
item.description: A landmark Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed on Sunday between the Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) and the Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF), aiming to enhance the welfare of garment sector workers, promote the growth of football, and strengthen the

item.title: Trust Bank signs MoU with RANGS Ltd
item.description: Trust Bank PLC has recently signed an agreement with RANGS Limited, the authorised distributor of Mitsubishi Motors in Bangladesh. Md. Wahed Ibne Shahed, Head of the Retail Banking Division of Trust Bank and Mohammad Fahim Hossain, Head of Marketing of RANGS Limited, signed the agreement on behalf

item.title: Trump says Venezuelan airspace should be considered closed
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela should be considered "closed in its entirety”, but gave no further details, stirring anxiety and confusion in Caracas as his administration ramps up pressure on President Nicolas Maduro's government. "To

item.title: Mercantile Bank’s Motijheel branch shifted to New Location
item.description: Mercantile Bank PLC's Motijheel branch has been shifted to Dhaka Chamber Building on Sunday (30.11.2025) to provide timely and unmatched banking services. item.title: Anamul serves legal notice after exclusion from BPL auction list
item.description: Bangladesh cricketer Anamul Haque Bijoy has served a legal notice to the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB), the BPL Governing Council and the Ministry of Youth and Sports after his name was left out of the players’ auction list for the upcoming BPL 2026 season. The notice, sent by Supreme Court

item.title: How AI is changing the way consumers shop this holiday season
item.description: Major retailers and tech giants are rolling out new or upgraded artificial intelligence tools for the holiday shopping rush, aiming to make gift buying easier for customers and capture a bigger portion of online sales. item.title: Special prayers offered at DU for Begum Khaleda Zia’s recovery
item.description: Special prayers were offered at Dhaka University (DU) on Sunday seeking the speedy recovery of former Prime Minister and BNP Chairperson Begum Khaleda Zia, who is currently suffering from a critical illness. The doa mahfil, organised by the DU administration, took place after Zuhr prayers at the u

item.title: Dhaka-Delhi ties won’t get stuck over Hasina issue: Foreign Adviser
item.description: Seeking convicted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s extradition, Foreign Affairs Adviser Md Touhid Hossain on Sunday said the relations between Bangladesh and India would not get stuck over a single issue. item.title: Bangladesh Bank extends tenure of Sukuk by additional five years
item.description: Bangladesh Bank (BB) has extended the tenure of the first Bangladesh Government Investment Sukuk by an additional five years.
